item.title: Why Can't We Help But Fall in Love With Our Own Solutions?
item.description: As developers, we often fall in love with our own solutions. We spend so much time and energy thinking about and building our solutions, that it’s easy to forget that the solution is not the end goal.

item.title: Proof of Email - The easiest way to onboard to blockchain
item.description: Have you ever wondered what it would be like to have your own blockchain address without the hassle of complicated phrases and secret words?

item.title: Why you should still learn to write (even if an AI can do it better)
item.description: In 1997, a computer called Deep Blue amazed the world by defeating the world chess champion, Garry Kasparov. This was a significant achievement for artificial intelligence, showing that machines could now compete with humans even in complex tasks like chess.
